trans-unit.source: How to configure Twitter authentication for your App Services application
trans-unit.target: How to configure Twitter authentication for your App Services application

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure Twitter authentication for your App Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure Twitter authentication for your App Services application.

trans-unit.source: How to configure your App Service application to use Twitter login
trans-unit.target: How to configure your App Service application to use Twitter login

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to configure Azure App Service to use Twitter as an authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to configure Azure App Service to use Twitter as an authentication provider.

trans-unit.source: To complete the procedure in this topic, you must have a Twitter account that has a verified email address.
trans-unit.target: To complete the procedure in this topic, you must have a Twitter account that has a verified email address.

trans-unit.source: To create a new Twitter account, go to twitter.com.
trans-unit.target: To create a new Twitter account, go to twitter.com.

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrates use of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature.
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrates use of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature.

trans-unit.source: This replaces the App Service gateway for most applications.
trans-unit.target: This replaces the App Service gateway for most applications.

trans-unit.source: Differences that apply to using the gateway are called out in notes throughout the topic.
trans-unit.target: Differences that apply to using the gateway are called out in notes throughout the topic.

trans-unit.source: Register your application with Twitter
trans-unit.target: Register your application with Twitter

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure portal], and navigate to your application.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure portal], and navigate to your application.

trans-unit.source: Copy your **URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy your **URL**.

trans-unit.source: You will use this to configure your Twitter app.
trans-unit.target: You will use this to configure your Twitter app.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the [Twitter Developers] website, sign-in with your Twitter account credentials, and click **Create New App**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the [Twitter Developers] website, sign-in with your Twitter account credentials, and click **Create New App**.

trans-unit.source: Type in the **Name** and a **Description** for your new app.
trans-unit.target: Type in the **Name** and a **Description** for your new app.

trans-unit.source: Paste in your application's **URL** for the **Website** value.
trans-unit.target: Paste in your application's **URL** for the **Website** value.

trans-unit.source: Then, for the **Callback URL**, paste the **Callback URL** you copied earlier.
trans-unit.target: Then, for the **Callback URL**, paste the **Callback URL** you copied earlier.

trans-unit.source: This is your Mobile App gateway appended with the path, _/.auth/login/twitter/callback_.
trans-unit.target: This is your Mobile App gateway appended with the path, _/.auth/login/twitter/callback_.

trans-unit.source: For example, `https://contoso.azurewebsites.net/.auth/login/twitter/callback`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `https://contoso.azurewebsites.net/.auth/login/twitter/callback`.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the App Service Gateway instead of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature, your redirect URL instead uses the gateway URL with the _/signin-twitter_ path.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the App Service Gateway instead of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature, your redirect URL instead uses the gateway URL with the _/signin-twitter_ path.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom the page, read and accept the terms.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom the page, read and accept the terms.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Create your Twitter application**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Create your Twitter application**.

trans-unit.source: This registers the app displays the application details.
trans-unit.target: This registers the app displays the application details.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Settings** tab, check **Allow this application to be used to sign in with Twitter**, then click **Update Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Settings** tab, check **Allow this application to be used to sign in with Twitter**, then click **Update Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Keys and Access Tokens** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Keys and Access Tokens** tab.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the values of **Consumer Key (API Key)** and **Consumer secret (API Secret)**.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the values of **Consumer Key (API Key)** and **Consumer secret (API Secret)**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The consumer secret is an important security credential.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The consumer secret is an important security credential.

trans-unit.source: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it with your app.
trans-unit.target: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it with your app.

trans-unit.source: Add Twitter information to your application
trans-unit.target: Add Twitter information to your application

trans-unit.source: If using the App Service Gateway, ignore this section and instead navigate to your gateway in the portal.
trans-unit.target: If using the App Service Gateway, ignore this section and instead navigate to your gateway in the portal.

trans-unit.source: Select **Settings**, **Identity**, and then **Twitter**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Settings**, **Identity**, and then **Twitter**.

trans-unit.source: Paste in the values you obtained earlier and click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Paste in the values you obtained earlier and click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Back in the [Azure portal], navigate to your application.
trans-unit.target: Back in the [Azure portal], navigate to your application.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings**, and then **Authentication / Authorization**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings**, and then **Authentication / Authorization**.

trans-unit.source: If the Authentication / Authorization feature is not enabled, turn the switch to **On**.
trans-unit.target: If the Authentication / Authorization feature is not enabled, turn the switch to **On**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Twitter**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Twitter**.

trans-unit.source: Paste in the App ID and App Secret values which you obtained previously.
trans-unit.target: Paste in the App ID and App Secret values which you obtained previously.

trans-unit.source: Then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: By default, App Service provides authentication but does not restrict authorized access to your site content and APIs.
trans-unit.target: By default, App Service provides authentication but does not restrict authorized access to your site content and APIs.

trans-unit.source: You must authorize users in your app code.
trans-unit.target: You must authorize users in your app code.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) To restrict access to your site to only users authenticated by Twitter, set **Action to take when request is not authenticated** to **Twitter**.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) To restrict access to your site to only users authenticated by Twitter, set **Action to take when request is not authenticated** to **Twitter**.

trans-unit.source: This requires that all requests be authenticated, and all unauthenticated requests are redirected to Twitter for authentication.
trans-unit.target: This requires that all requests be authenticated, and all unauthenticated requests are redirected to Twitter for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use Twitter for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use Twitter for authentication in your app.

trans-unit.source: Related Content
trans-unit.target: Related Content
